lexUnit.name: reproach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express to (someone) one's disapproval of or disappointment in their actions.

sentence.text: Sometimes Soutine , who was living in the village , came over to enjoy a good chicken dinner , and after eating their fill the two artists reproached their host for living in such luxury .
An old man then reproaches Faustus for selling his soul and counsels repentance which Faustus inclines towards .
After we 've signed the visitors ' book , he reproaches my husband for picking up his bag : ` We have a bag-carrying service . "
When at last the government saw how matters were developing , it began to reproach industry for failing to respond to its ` anti-inflationary " measures .
Critics of the administration reproached Bush for his failure to take real steps to tackle the deficit .
Middlesbrough were portrayed as extravagant young upstarts ( the club had only been in the Football League since 1899 ) , and Sunderland were reproached for daring to ask for such a sum .
I understood him to reproach us for being slow in commissioning the fourth vessel .
You reproach me for being stupidly repelled by a taste of which I have never dared to become fully aware .
She stood by him , she never reproached him for his failings , and at times he felt even worse because she was so forbearing .
Biting her lip Amabel reproached herself thoroughly and sincerely for not having forced her to wear those whalebone stays all night when she had been growing up .
If so , you all reproach me with your cheerful resilience . "
He could reproach her with it .
He was about to ask her what in the world she was doing in the East End when he was reproached by an angry Sally-Anne .
They chivvy and reproach each other as we eat .
The Armenian Bolshevik , Shahumyan , reproached him -- as many were to do -- with exaggerating the dangers here and was roundly chastised :
She kills it , and Mira reproaches her in a spirit of raillery for similar treatment of two admirers , Cynthio and Amintor :
And you were right to reproach me over McAllister .
By the time Sister returned Wendy had removed the rest of the baby 's wrapping , and was reproached for so doing .
You and Fred have nothing to reproach yourselves with .
Even the pope recently reproached local politicians on a visit to Naples for their self-interest and neglect of their constituents .
They can feel hurried and driven , critical and quick to reproach .
